title: 3787 Intermittent Black
message: Inspected and they are pulled garbage nicely sanded so it almost looks real, FUCK CHINA.

title: 3787 Intermittent Black
message: Duke, how are you checking if they're sanded? I just got in 40 chips and they look pretty good, but do have extremely light "scratches" (1 or 2, about 1/6th the width of the chip itself) on random areas of the top surface; not concentrated towards edges or anything. The bottoms look pretty good, very clean, but with 1 or 2 "imperfect" marks on the bottom of each. Hard to tell if they're from being pulled or not. Edges are all perfectly crisp, no chipping or signs of scuffing, etc. I can post photos if you would like.

title: 3787 Intermittent Black
message: Mine had different date codes and the edges were a bit crumbled. Also the pads on the sides of the chip should all be copper colored.

title: 3787 Intermittent Black
message: I'm looking for compatible chips. 6808 was only used by Apple so finding these new will be hopeless. I'm pretty sure FDMF6708N is a good replacement, anyone want to try? If you are in US you can get them quick from Mouser, I have them on order from China.

title: 3787 Intermittent Black
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 39129"]I'm looking for compatible chips. 6808 was only used by Apple so finding these new will be hopeless. I'm pretty sure FDMF6708N is a good replacement, anyone want to try? If you are in US you can get them quick from Mouser, I have them on order from China.[/QUOTE]

I'll give it a try with the 6708N.
There are quite a few DC/DC chips (FDMF67XXX FDMF68XXX) that seem to fit the bill. The only notable difference seems to be current capability and 5V or 3V3 PWM input. I've not properly look at the data sheets though, just a quick glance at Absolute Max, Pin Out and Typical Application sections.

title: 3787 Intermittent Black
message: No very few fit the bill as it needs the ZCD function on pin 1 and be at least 40A.
